Text.Value: Everywhere - the city is infested. I've been monitoring them for months now - they're planning something. Something big.

EditorData.NodeContext: glancing at player with cocked eyebrow - worried, concerned

Text.Value: My son has taken up the mantle. He fights tooth and nail every single day. I only pray it's enough. That I've done enough.

EditorData.NodeContext: clearly scared for his son, feels useless

Text.Value: If I could, I would be at my son's side in a heartbeat. I have known no greater pain than being forced to watch him fight alone.

EditorData.NodeContext: cold, angry, offended

Text.Value: You don't hear many people discussing mind flayers.
I will pray that your son will swiftly and brutally murder the mind flayer.
Mind flayers are dangerous. He should stay away from them.
Maybe worry about yourself - you didn't even hear me coming.
If I were you, I'd leave the city. This place is done for.
I'm hunting them, too - and I could use someone like you.
Mind flayer? Where?
An illithid trap left me retired - permanently. Writing is how I spend much of my days now.

EditorData.NodeContext: a sad smile, he feels frustrated

Text.Value: Wait - the Golbraith? I read your book on psionic manipulations and countermeasures.
Does your son need any help?
Anyone who kills those bastards is a friend of mine. Does your son need help?
It is rare to meet someone who doesn't fear mind flayers. You remind me of an old friend - a hero of his time.

EditorData.NodeContext: proud, filled with admiration, hint of affection at the end (the 'hero' he met is the protagonist of BG1)

Text.Value: He's more than that - I couldn't be prouder of him.

EditorData.NodeContext: emotional, these words can't express how much he loves and adores his son.

Text.Value: You know of them? Good - you don't meet many in this city with their eyes open.

EditorData.NodeContext: glancing at player with cocked eyebrow - pleased and impressed with player

Text.Value: You don't know my boy - he's twice the hunter I am, and the best son a man could ask for.

EditorData.NodeContext: cold, angry, offended

Text.Value: That mind flayer is done for.

EditorData.NodeContext: muttering to himself, maybe hand on chin, doesn't look up at player, trying to reassure himself - DETERMINED

Text.Value: Normally I'd refuse - we need sharp minds and sharper blades. But we could use all the help we can get.

EditorData.NodeContext: Small smile to himself - he's worried about his son

Text.Value: Here - he gifted me this. Call it thanks for setting me at ease.

EditorData.NodeContext: proud, filled with admiration, hint of affection at the end (the 'hero' he met is the protagonist of BG1). Generic handing motion.

Text.Value: I've said all I wish to the likes of you.

EditorData.NodeContext: cold, offended

Text.Value: Golbraith Stredivas - mind flayer hunter. My son is tracking one of the beasts as we speak.

EditorData.NodeContext:
confident at beginning, clearly a little worried about son

(GOL-breyth STRE-di-vass; /'golbreɪθ 'stredɪvæs/)

Text.Value: Impressive. I see the mark of a true hunter about you.
I can say a prayer for your son's swift return.
I am pleased it is still widely read. I hope to publish many more such volumes.

EditorData.NodeContext: a smile, he doesn't meet many who know his work

Text.Value: A surface dweller who hunts illithids? I'm almost impressed.
Never - not while my son is out there. Not while people still need help. But it's good to know where you stand - coward.

EditorData.NodeContext: cold, angry, offended

Text.Value: If your son is half the hunter you are, he'll be all right.
What are you talking about?
You don't know my boy - he's twice the hunter I am, and the best son a man could ask for.

EditorData.NodeContext: proud, quietly happy, a slight smile

Text.Value: He has twice the kills you did at that age. He knows the seven major arteries, the blind spots - everything.

EditorData.NodeContext: muttering to himself, maybe hand on chin, doesn't look up at player, trying to reassure himself

Text.Value: I'll thank you to show yourself out.

EditorData.NodeContext: cold, angry, offended

Text.Value: I'd be by his side, but an illithid trap left me retired - permanently.

EditorData.NodeContext: sad, feels useless, wishes he could help his son

Text.Value: Go on - you have mind flayers to kill.

EditorData.NodeContext: smile, proud

Text.Value: You mean before or after you thundered into my home like a wounded umber hulk? Make no mistake - you're here because I allow it.

EditorData.NodeContext: glancing at player with cocked eyebrow - quietly confident.

Text.Value: Impressive. I see the mark of a true warrior about you.
I'd have jumped at that chance a few years back, but an illithid trap left me retired - permanently.

EditorData.NodeContext: worried, regretful, wincing at end at the memory - he wishes desperately he could still fight

Text.Value: Forgive me, I was speaking to myself - a habit solitude has encouraged.
An old friend gifted me this. Call it thanks for setting me at ease.

EditorData.NodeContext: proud, filled with admiration, hint of affection at friend (the protagonist of BG1). Generic handing motion.

Text.Value: No. The more minds for an illithid to feast on, the greater the risk - as I know too well. I tried to save another - and wound up retired. Permanently.

EditorData.NodeContext: worried, regretful, wincing at end at the memory - he wishes desperately he could still fight

Text.Value: They won't win, you know - the mind flayers. Not with my son fighting the good fight. And you.

EditorData.NodeContext: determined, proud, admiration.

Text.Value: You should be out there fighting - not hiding in here!
Then your son is a dead man.
If you were the warrior you pretended to be, you'd understand that. I'll thank you to show yourself out.

EditorData.NodeContext: cold, angry, offended

Text.Value: You've done your part - let us take it from here. We know how to deal with them.

Synopsis:
Fan tribute dialog that should provide players with some tasty lore provided that they give a drink to Golbraith.

Players stumle into Golbraith by exploring the city and entering his house.
